## Installation

You can install the development version of multitool from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("ethan-young/multitool")
```

## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(multitool)
```

## Simulate some data

```{r data}
the_data <-
  data.frame(
    id   = 1:500,
    iv1  = rnorm(500),
    iv2  = rnorm(500),
    iv3  = rnorm(500),
    mod1 = rnorm(500),
    mod2 = rnorm(500),
    mod3 = rnorm(500),
    cov1 = rnorm(500),
    cov2 = rnorm(500),
    dv1  = rnorm(500),
    dv2  = rnorm(500),
    include1 = rbinom(500, size = 1, prob = .1),
    include2 = sample(1:3, size = 500, replace = TRUE),
    include3 = rnorm(500)
  )
```

## Create a variable grid

```{r filter_grid}
my_var_grid <-
  create_var_grid(
    my_data = the_data,
    iv  = c(iv1, iv2, iv3),
    mod = c(mod1, mod2, mod3),
    dv  = c(dv1, dv2),
    cov = c(cov1, cov2)
  )
```

## Create filter grid

```{r variable_grid}
my_filter_grid <-
  create_filter_grid(
    my_data = the_data,
    include1 == 0,
    include2 != 3,
    include2 != 2,
    scale(include3) > -2.5
  )
```

## Create model grid

```{r model_grid}
my_model_grid <-
  create_model_grid(
    lm({dv} ~ {iv} * {mod}),
    lm({dv} ~ {iv} * {mod} + {cov})
  )
```

## Add arbitrary code

```{r}
#Add pre-processing code before model is fit (but after filtering)
my_preprocess <-
  create_preprocess(
    mutate({iv} := scale({iv}) |> as.numeric(), {mod} := scale({mod}) |> as.numeric())
  )
```

```{r}
# Code to execute after analysis is fit
my_postprocess <-
  create_postprocess(
    aov()
  )
```

## Combine all grids together

```{r combine_grids}
my_full_grid <-
  combine_all_grids(
    my_var_grid,
    my_filter_grid,
    my_model_grid,
    my_preprocess,
    my_postprocess
  )
```

## Run a universe

```{r}
run_universe(my_full_grid, the_data, 1)
```

## Run a multiverse

```{r}
run_multiverse(my_full_grid[1:10,], the_data)
```
